quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Define the Data Model[/h1]

The [b]data model[/b] stores the information to be displayed by the scene. To define it, define a simple class with the properties needed for the items. For our purposes, we need a name property of type [b]String[/b].
To create a new data model class, choose File > New > File 
When the dialog appears, select Source under iOS over to the left.
Select [b]Swift File[/b], and click [b]Next[/b].
In the Save As field, type Item as the name of your model.
Click [b]Create[/b], and Xcode creates a file called[i] Item.swift.[/i]

Add the following code to create the class: [code format="swift"]class [b]Item[/b] { 
   var name: String

   init(name: String) {
     self.name = name
   }
}[/code]
[note]This newly defined class can now be used to add items to our table.[/note]
